synopsis: Raven Darkholme operates as a free agent in the post-Krakoan landscape, no longer bound by the Quiet Council's politics or the need to play nice for the sake of mutant unity. Shalvey writes and draws a spy thriller as Mystique navigates the intelligence underworld, taking contracts from multiple factions while pursuing her own agenda. Without Destiny by her side — the precognitive mutant whose visions guided Mystique's every move on Krakoa — Raven must rely on her own judgment for the first time in years. The result is a character study of one of Marvel's most complex figures: mother, terrorist, spy, lover, shapeshifter, and survivor. Shalvey's art is moody and precise, using Mystique's shapeshifting abilities for visual storytelling that plays with identity and perception. Each issue features a different disguise and a different moral compromise. The series connects to the broader From the Ashes mutant landscape while maintaining a distinct espionage-genre identity.
connection_notes: Post-Krakoa era. Mystique character study. Parallel: From the Ashes titles. Connects to: Destiny, Brotherhood legacy.

title: Psylocke by Alyssa Wong
synopsis: Kwannon, the original Psylocke reclaimed, carves out her identity in the post-Krakoan world. Wong addresses the character's complicated history — the body-swap with Betsy Braddock, the decades of confused identity, the Krakoan era that finally separated the two women — with sensitivity and directness. Kwannon's psychic knife abilities manifest differently than Betsy's telepathy, emphasizing the assassin training that defines her. A new threat targets psychic mutants specifically, draining their mental energy to power a machine that could lobotomize every telepath on Earth simultaneously. Kwannon must protect her daughter, whom she barely knows, while hunting the threat. The Hand, Kwannon's former organization, resurfaces with claims on her loyalty. The series is a tight five-issue action thriller that finally gives Kwannon the solo spotlight she deserves, establishing her firmly as her own character rather than an appendage to Betsy Braddock's story.
connection_notes: Post-Krakoa era. From the Ashes title. Connects to: Hellions (Kwannon's Krakoan development), broader X-line.

title: NYX by Collin Kelly & Jackson Lanzing
synopsis: In post-Krakoa New York City, young mutants navigate a world where the dream of a mutant nation just collapsed and humanity's anti-mutant sentiment is resurgent. Kelly and Lanzing revive the NYX concept — street-level young mutant stories in the city — with Ms. Marvel (Kamala Khan, now confirmed as mutant), Anole, Prodigy, Sophie Cuckoo, and Wolverine (Laura Kinney). The series operates at the intersection of the X-Men line and the broader New York street-level universe. Kamala's mutant identity, established during Fall of X, places her uniquely between the Avengers and X-Men worlds. The young mutants operate without institutional support, squatting in abandoned buildings and protecting their community through direct action rather than superheroics. Anti-mutant hate groups, emboldened by Krakoa's fall, target mutant neighborhoods. The series provides the ground-level perspective on post-Krakoan mutant life that the flagship titles are too busy with cosmic threats to explore.
connection_notes: Post-Krakoa era. From the Ashes title. Ms. Marvel bridge between Avengers and X-Men. Parallel: Exceptional X-Men, Uncanny X-Men.

title: Sentinels by Alex Paknadel
synopsis: In the most conceptually daring From the Ashes title, human minds are uploaded into decommissioned Sentinel robots and tasked with protecting mutants rather than hunting them. The premise inverts sixty years of X-Men iconography — the ultimate symbol of anti-mutant genocide repurposed as guardians. The human operators, each chosen for their lack of anti-mutant prejudice, struggle with the psychological horror of inhabiting bodies designed for murder. Paknadel explores identity, embodiment, and whether the tools of oppression can ever truly be reformed. The public reacts with justified suspicion: are these Sentinels different, or will they inevitably revert to their programming? The mutants they protect are equally wary. One Sentinel operator begins experiencing the ghost of the robot's original kill programming. The series is a philosophical science fiction story wearing superhero clothing, and it represents the From the Ashes initiative's willingness to take genuine creative risks with the X-Men franchise.
connection_notes: From the Ashes title. Post-Krakoa era. Inverts classic X-Men Sentinel threat. Parallel: broader X-line.

title: Magik by Ashley Allen
synopsis: Illyana Rasputin, the Darkchylde, confronts the demons of Limbo — and her own nature — in her first solo series in years. Post-Krakoa, Magik is unmoored: the island that gave her community and purpose is gone, and Limbo's demonic realm calls to the part of her soul that was forged there as a child. Allen explores Illyana's dual nature as both a New Mutant and the ruler of a demon dimension, a character defined by childhood trauma who has never fully processed it because there was always another crisis. Limbo itself is changing, its demonic ecosystem responding to Krakoa's fall in unexpected ways. S'ym and N'astirh, Illyana's classic demon adversaries, return with new agendas. Colossus appears, the brother-sister relationship providing emotional grounding. Peralta's art handles both the horror of Limbo and the emotional intimacy of character moments with equal skill. The series treats Illyana's complexity as an asset rather than a problem to solve.
connection_notes: Post-Krakoa era. Character spotlight. Connects to: New Mutants legacy, Limbo mythology. Parallel: From the Ashes titles.

title: Storm by Murewa Ayodele
synopsis: Ororo Munroe steps into her long-overdue first ongoing solo series with the weight of the Krakoan era on her shoulders. As Regent of Arakko, Storm ruled a planet. Now, post-Krakoa, she applies that leadership experience to global crisis intervention — using her weather powers to address climate disasters, droughts, and humanitarian crises that superheroes typically ignore. Ayodele, a Nigerian writer, brings cultural specificity to Storm's African heritage that the character has rarely received from Western writers. Ororo returns to Kenya, confronting her origins as a worshipped goddess and what that means for a woman who has been an X-Man, a queen, a regent, and now something new. A weather-manipulation villain who can match Storm's powers provides the physical threat. The political implications of a single person who can end droughts but chooses when and where to act are explored with nuance. Werneck's art gives Storm the visual grandeur she deserves — every lightning bolt, every tornado rendered with awe-inspiring power.
connection_notes: Post-Krakoa era. Storm's Arakko regency (X-Men Red) as background. From the Ashes title. Standalone but enriched by Krakoan context.

title: Black Panther by Eve L. Ewing
synopsis: T'Challa faces a Wakanda transformed by One World Under Doom. Doom's brief global rule exposed Wakanda's vibranium monopoly to new scrutiny: if one nation's resources can save the world, does that nation have the right to hoard them? Ewing explores the post-Doom political landscape through Wakanda's lens as neighboring nations, emboldened by Doom's precedent, make claims on vibranium access. T'Challa must navigate between Wakandan sovereignty and global responsibility — the same tension that defined his earliest appearances in Fantastic Four #52. Shuri serves as scientific advisor and occasional field operative. The Dora Milaje face new threats. A revolutionary movement within Wakanda, inspired by Doom's demonstration that absolute power can produce absolute good, challenges the monarchy's authority. Ewing writes T'Challa as statesman first, superhero second, grounding the action in geopolitical realism. Allen's art brings kineticism to both political chambers and battlefield.
connection_notes: Post-One World Under Doom. Wakanda political thriller. Parallel: Avengers, broader Marvel landscape. Connects to: original Black Panther FF appearances thematically.

title: Phases of the Moon Knight
synopsis: An anthology series exploring different aspects of Marc Spector's shattered psyche, with each issue written and drawn by a different creative team. The format mirrors Moon Knight's dissociative identity disorder — each creative team brings a different interpretation, a different 'phase' of the character, and readers must reconcile the contradictions just as Marc does. One issue follows Steven Grant's millionaire persona in a heist story. Another drops Jake Lockley into noir detective territory. A third explores Mr. Knight's consulting detective work. The Khonshu relationship is reexamined through multiple lenses — is he a god, a delusion, or something in between? The anthology format allows Marvel to showcase emerging talent alongside established creators, each bringing their own vision of what Moon Knight means. Following Jed MacKay's acclaimed run, the series provides breathing room before the next definitive take on the character while keeping him visible in the publishing line.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Moon Knight by MacKay (recommended). Anthology format. Standalone stories. Parallel: broader Marvel street-level.

title: Avengers: Twilight
synopsis: Chip Zdarsky and Daniel Acuna deliver Marvel's answer to The Dark Knight Returns — a prestige, out-of-continuity story set in a future where superheroes have been outlawed and an elderly Steve Rogers must reassemble the Avengers one last time. Tony Stark is a recluse. T'Challa rules a Wakanda that has sealed its borders permanently. James Rhodes carries wounds both physical and psychological. Luke Cage navigates a society that criminalized heroism. The threat is not a supervillain but systemic — a government that determined heroes were more dangerous than the threats they fought, with the public's willing complicity. Rogers must confront whether the America he fought for ever truly existed or if he was always defending an ideal that his country never lived up to. Acuna's painted art creates a melancholy, twilight atmosphere that perfectly suits the narrative. The parallels to real-world authoritarianism are intentional and pointed. This is Zdarsky at his most ambitious.
connection_notes: Standalone alternate future. No continuity prerequisites. Prestige miniseries. Thematic connection to One World Under Doom's freedom vs. security questions.

title: Fantastic Four: Full Circle
synopsis: Alex Ross writes and paints an original Fantastic Four graphic novel that serves as a love letter to the Lee/Kirby era while pushing the visual medium to its limits. A mysterious signal from the Negative Zone triggers a crisis that forces Reed, Sue, Johnny, and Ben into Annihilus's domain — but the real threat is something that has been hiding in the Negative Zone since the FF's very first exploration. Ross's fully painted art is staggering: every panel is a museum-quality painting, every character rendered with the photorealistic grandeur that made Marvels and Kingdom Come landmarks. The story deliberately echoes FF #1 and the Negative Zone exploration from Annual #6, creating a circular narrative about legacy, return, and the enduring wonder of discovery. Ross's love for the original material is evident in every page, but this is not mere nostalgia — it is a meditation on why these characters endure and what they represent about human curiosity and family bonds.
connection_notes: Standalone original graphic novel. No strict prerequisites. Love letter to Lee/Kirby FF. Companion to Marvels by Ross/Busiek.

title: Marvel Voices: Heritage
issues_collected: Marvel Voices: Heritage #1, Marvel Voices: Pride #1, Marvel Voices: Legacy #1, Marvel Voices: Identity #1, Marvel Voices: Comunidades #1
synopsis: Marvel's anthology series celebrating diverse voices and perspectives across the Marvel Universe, collected here in a comprehensive volume. Heritage spotlights Indigenous characters and creators. Pride centers LGBTQ+ heroes including Northstar, Iceman, America Chavez, Mystique, and others. Legacy focuses on Black heroes and creators. Identity highlights Asian and Asian-American characters from Shang-Chi to Silk to Ms. Marvel. Comunidades celebrates Latinx heroes and culture. Each anthology features short stories written and drawn by creators from the communities being represented, providing perspectives that mainstream titles rarely center. The stories range from intimate character studies to action-packed adventures, with standout contributions from creators who bring personal experience to established characters. These anthologies are where Marvel most consistently publishes new voices and takes creative risks.
connection_notes: Standalone anthology collection. No prerequisites. Features characters from across the Marvel Universe. Showcases diverse creators.

title: Ultimate Universe by Hickman Omnibus Vol. 2
issues_collected: Ultimate Spider-Man (2024) #7-12, Ultimate Black Panther #7-12, Ultimate X-Men #7-12, Ultimates (2024) #1-6
synopsis: The second omnibus collecting the new Ultimate Universe line continues all four core titles plus adds the Ultimates team book. Hickman's Ultimate Spider-Man deepens Peter Parker's war against the Maker as the Green Goblin threat escalates. Hill's Ultimate Black Panther expands Wakanda's role in a world secretly controlled by evil Reed Richards. Momoko's Ultimate X-Men pushes further into Japanese mythology-infused mutant storytelling. Camp's Ultimates assembles this universe's first superhero team — a moment that carries enormous weight because the Maker specifically prevented heroes from ever organizing. The omnibus format reveals how Hickman has constructed a second interconnected universe where the same themes of his 616 work (cosmic scale, long-term planning, the power of community against tyranny) play out in a sandbox unburdened by sixty years of continuity. The Ultimate Universe experiment is working, both commercially and creatively.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Ultimate Universe By Hickman Omnibus Vol. 1. Continues all Ultimate Universe titles. Ongoing line.

title: Fall of the House of X
issues_collected: Fall of the House of X #1-5
synopsis: The companion series to Rise of the Powers of X, Fall of the House of X follows the ground-level assault on Orchis as the Krakoan era reaches its conclusion. While Gillen's Rise handles the cosmic and metaphysical resolution, Duggan's Fall delivers the visceral, physical confrontation. Cyclops escapes captivity and leads the X-Men in a final battle against Orchis's combined forces: Nimrod, Omega Sentinel, and the human supremacist infrastructure that has hunted mutants for decades. The public execution planned for the X-Men becomes a turning point as humanity watches and must choose a side. Iron Man and Captain America's response to the mutant crisis reflects the broader Marvel Universe's relationship with the X-Men. Wolverine faces Omega Red. Jean Grey confronts the psychic defenses. Emma Frost's long double-agent game reaches its payoff. The series is the action counterpart to Rise's philosophical resolution, and together they provide complete closure to the Krakoan experiment.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Fall of X. Companion to Rise of the Powers of X. Ends Krakoan era. Leads to: From the Ashes relaunch. Essential.

title: One World Under Doom: Avengers
issues_collected: Avengers (2023) #20-24, One World Under Doom: Avengers #1
synopsis: The Avengers confront the impossible dilemma of One World Under Doom from the inside: Doom has conquered the world and made it objectively better, and the team fractures over whether to fight him. Captain America (Sam Wilson) leads the resistance faction on principle — freedom cannot be gifted by a tyrant, no matter how benevolent. But other Avengers see Doom's results and hesitate. Children are no longer dying of preventable diseases. Wars have ended. Climate change is being reversed by Latverian technology. MacKay explores what happens when the Avengers' mission — protect the world — conflicts with their values, because the world is being protected by someone they cannot endorse. Tony Stark faces his darkest mirror: Doom is doing what Tony always dreamed of, using technology to fix everything, but with the moral flexibility Tony refuses. The series is the Avengers-focused lens on the OWUD event and is essential for understanding the team's fracture.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: One World Under Doom core series, Avengers by MacKay. OWUD tie-in. Avengers perspective on Doom's conquest.

title: One World Under Doom: Spider-Man
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man (2022) #62-66, One World Under Doom: Spider-Man #1
synopsis: Spider-Man operates in a New York City transformed by Doom's global rule, where crime has plummeted because Doom's enforcement leaves no room for it. Peter Parker faces the absurdist reality of being a vigilante in a world that no longer needs vigilantes — Doom's Doombots patrol more efficiently than Spider-Man ever could. But Peter's spider-sense tells him something is wrong beneath the surface, and he investigates Doom's infrastructure in Queens, discovering that the 'improvements' come at a hidden cost to personal autonomy. Kelly writes Peter with the humor and heart that defined his classic ASM run, and McGuinness's dynamic art brings energy to both web-swinging action and quiet Parker moments. The series explores Spider-Man's unique position in the OWUD landscape: he is too street-level to challenge Doom directly but too stubborn to stop looking for the catch.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: One World Under Doom core series. OWUD tie-in. Spider-Man perspective on Doom's world. Parallel: ASM ongoing.

title: X-Men: From the Ashes Vol. 2
synopsis: The flagship X-Men title continues as MacKay deepens the post-Krakoan status quo. Cyclops leads the team from their new base in Alaska, returning to the frontier mentality that defined the earliest X-Men stories — a small team, limited resources, enormous threats. The mutant population, scattered after Krakoa's fall, slowly begins to reconvene around Cyclops's beacon. A new generation of Sentinels, built from salvaged Orchis technology, represents the persistent mechanical threat. MacKay introduces a compelling new villain who views the post-Krakoan moment as the perfect opportunity to finish what Orchis started. Stegman's art is muscular and kinetic, bringing a visual intensity that suits the series' action-heavy approach. The relationship dynamics between Scott, Jean, and the core team are handled with maturity. Cyclops's leadership, tested by the loss of everything Krakoa built, evolves into something harder and more pragmatic without losing the idealism that defines the X-Men mission.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: X-Men From the Ashes Vol. 1. Ongoing flagship. Parallel: all From the Ashes titles. Leads to: continued X-Men.

title: Armageddon Prelude: Road to Armageddon
issues_collected: Upcoming — Free Comic Book Day 2026: Armageddon, Armageddon prelude material
synopsis: The bridge material between One World Under Doom's conclusion and Armageddon, Marvel's 2026 event. Following Doom's defeat and the restoration of global sovereignty, the world is fundamentally altered: nations that experienced Doom's enforced utopia struggle with the return of their old problems. A power vacuum the size of the entire planet creates opportunities for threats both terrestrial and cosmic. Zdarsky plants seeds across the Marvel line as the characters most affected by OWUD — the Avengers, the Fantastic Four, the X-Men — begin to sense a convergence of threats that dwarfs anything they have faced individually. The Free Comic Book Day issue provides the inciting incident. The prelude material establishes the stakes: this is not just another event but the culmination of threads Zdarsky has been weaving since his Daredevil run. Armageddon aims to be the decade-defining Marvel event.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: One World Under Doom. Direct bridge to Armageddon (2026). Sets up the next major Marvel event.

title: Blade: Vampire Hunter TPB
synopsis: Blade's first ongoing solo series. The Daywalker hunts vampires across New York while confronting his own hybrid nature. Introduces supporting cast and expands Blade's mythology beyond Tomb of Dracula.
connection_notes: Spins off from: Tomb of Dracula. Leads to: Blade (2006).

title: Blade by Marc Guggenheim
synopsis: Blade tackles a new vampire conspiracy while dealing with S.H.I.E.L.D. interference. Features Blade joining the Initiative-era Marvel Universe and confronting Wolverine's son Daken.
connection_notes: Parallel: Civil War era. Leads to: Blade appearances in Mighty Avengers.

title: Blade (2023) by Bryan Edward Hill
synopsis: Modern Blade solo series setting up his role in Blood Hunt. Blade investigates a new vampire nation rising in the shadows, leading directly into the Blood Hunt event.
connection_notes: Leads to: Blood Hunt event. Prerequisite for Blood Hunt.

title: Namor the Sub-Mariner by John Byrne Omnibus
synopsis: Byrne reinvents Namor as a corporate CEO running Oracle Inc. while defending Atlantis. Features Namor vs. the Marrs twins, the Iron Fist connection, and Namorita's origin revelations.
connection_notes: Spins off from: Avengers. Parallel: Acts of Vengeance crossover. Leads to: Namor in Heroes Reborn.

title: Namor: The First Mutant Complete Collection
synopsis: Namor's mutant heritage is foregrounded as he navigates between Atlantis and the X-Men's Utopia. Ties into the Curse of the Mutants vampire storyline and Namor's role in Cyclops's inner circle.
connection_notes: Parallel: Uncanny X-Men by Fraction. Leads to: Avengers vs. X-Men (Namor destroys Wakanda).

title: Namor: Conquered Shores
synopsis: Set in a future where the oceans have risen and Namor rules the last civilization. An elderly Captain America arrives seeking help. A meditative, prestige miniseries exploring legacy and mortality.
connection_notes: Standalone future story. Thematic companion to: Earth X, Marvel 2099.

title: Hawkeye by Mark Gruenwald Omnibus
synopsis: Hawkeye's first solo mini and his Solo Avengers backup stories. Clint Barton establishes himself outside the Avengers, battles Crossfire, and solidifies his relationship with Mockingbird.
connection_notes: Spins off from: Avengers. Parallel: West Coast Avengers. Leads to: Hawkeye in WCA.

title: Hawkeye & Mockingbird / Black Widow: Widowmaker
synopsis: Clint and Bobbi Morse reunite post-Secret Invasion for espionage adventures. The Widowmaker crossover ties in Black Widow. Features Phantom Rider and Crossfire as antagonists.
connection_notes: Follows: Secret Invasion, Mockingbird's return. Parallel: Heroic Age Avengers.

title: Hawkeye: Freefall
synopsis: Clint Barton goes undercover as the Hood to infiltrate the criminal underworld. A street-level noir take on Hawkeye that tests his moral limits as he gets deeper into the role.
connection_notes: Standalone Hawkeye story. Parallel: Krakoa-era Marvel.

title: Hawkeye: Kate Bishop by Mariko Tamaki
synopsis: Kate Bishop returns to New York as a PI investigating a resort that may be stealing superpowers from young women. Continues Kate's solo trajectory after the Fraction/Lemire era.
connection_notes: Follows: Hawkeye by Fraction. Parallel: West Coast Avengers (2018).

title: Black Widow by Waid & Samnee
synopsis: Natasha Romanoff goes rogue to prevent S.H.I.E.L.D. from weaponizing secrets from her past. Samnee's kinetic art drives a relentless spy thriller. The Weeping Lion and the Red Room return.
connection_notes: Standalone. Follows: Secret Avengers. Leads to: Secret Empire (Natasha's death).

title: Black Widow by Kelly Thompson Complete Collection
synopsis: Natasha is brainwashed into a suburban life with false memories. She escapes and unravels a conspiracy by Apogee. Features her relationship with James Barnes and a new costume. The definitive modern Widow run.
connection_notes: Follows: Black Widow by Waid/Samnee. Leads to: Blood Hunt era.

title: Black Widow: Yelena Belova Complete Collection
issues_collected: Black Widow (1999) #1-3, Black Widow (2001) #1-6, Black Widow: Pale Little Spider #1-3
synopsis: Yelena Belova, the second Black Widow, emerges from the Red Room determined to prove herself superior to Natasha. The Marvel Knights minis that introduced the character popularized by the MCU.
connection_notes: Parallel: Marvel Knights Daredevil. Leads to: New Avengers (Yelena as Super-Adaptoid).

title: Sensational She-Hulk by John Byrne Omnibus
synopsis: The legendary fourth-wall-breaking She-Hulk run. Jennifer Walters addresses the reader directly, tears through pages, and threatens to rip up the Comics Code. Comedy gold with real character development.
connection_notes: Follows: Savage She-Hulk. Parallel: FF by Simonson. Leads to: She-Hulk by Slott.

title: She-Hulk by Mariko Tamaki
synopsis: Post-Civil War II, Jennifer Walters struggles with PTSD and grief after being nearly killed. A deeply personal story about trauma and recovery, with Jen as gray Hulk. Hellcat guest stars.
connection_notes: Follows: Civil War II (Jen's near-death). Parallel: All-New All-Different Marvel.

title: She-Hulk by Rainbow Rowell
synopsis: Jen Walters rebuilds her life and law career after years of Hulk trauma. Romance with Jack of Hearts, legal cases for super-powered clients, and a return to the fun, confident She-Hulk readers love.
connection_notes: Follows: Avengers by Aaron. Parallel: ongoing Krakoa-era Marvel.

title: Shang-Chi by Gene Luen Yang
synopsis: Shang-Chi discovers he has siblings and inherits the Five Weapons Society from his father Zheng Zu. Reinvents Shang-Chi's mythology, adding the Ten Rings connection and family drama.
connection_notes: Follows: Shang-Chi classic era. Leads to: Shang-Chi and the Ten Rings.

title: Shang-Chi and the Ten Rings
synopsis: Shang-Chi leads the Five Weapons Society against a resurgent Ten Rings organization. Continues the family dynamics and martial arts mythology established in the previous series.
connection_notes: Follows: Shang-Chi by Yang. Parallel: ongoing Marvel continuity.

title: Captain Britain Omnibus by Alan Moore & Alan Davis
issues_collected: Marvel Super-Heroes #377-388, The Daredevils #1-11, Mighty World of Marvel #7-16, Captain Britain (1985) #1-14
synopsis: Alan Moore and Alan Davis redefine Captain Britain. Introduces the Captain Britain Corps, the Omniversal Majestrix Saturnyne, and Mad Jim Jaspers' reality warp. The foundation for all multiverse stories at Marvel.
connection_notes: Leads to: Excalibur by Claremont/Davis. Essential prerequisite for understanding the Captain Britain Corps and Marvel multiverse.

title: Knights of Pendragon Complete Collection
issues_collected: Knights of Pendragon (1990) #1-18, Knights of Pendragon (1992) #1-15
synopsis: British heroes empowered by the Pendragon spirit, blending Arthurian legend with Marvel superheroics. Features Captain Britain, Union Jack, and new characters defending Britain from mystical threats.
connection_notes: Parallel: Captain Britain Corps mythology. Spins off from: Captain Britain Omnibus.

title: Quasar Classic Omnibus by Mark Gruenwald
synopsis: Wendell Vaughn becomes Protector of the Universe wielding the Quantum Bands. A cosmic odyssey featuring Eon, the Star Brand, Maelstrom, and the Kree-Shi'ar War. Gruenwald's love letter to cosmic Marvel.
connection_notes: Ties into: Operation Galactic Storm, Infinity Gauntlet. Parallel: Silver Surfer ongoing. Leads to: Annihilation (Quasar's death).

title: Ant-Man by Nick Spencer Complete Collection
synopsis: Scott Lang moves to Miami, starts a security company, and tries to be a good dad to Cassie. Hilarious and heartfelt, featuring Grizzly, Machinesmith, and Darren Cross as the new Yellowjacket.
connection_notes: Parallel: All-New All-Different Marvel. Leads to: Ant-Man & the Wasp (2018).

title: Ant-Man by Zeb Wells
synopsis: Scott Lang takes a job from a villain to pay for Cassie's bail. A comedic heist story where Ant-Man must pull off an impossible theft while navigating his complicated personal life.
connection_notes: Standalone Ant-Man story. Parallel: Krakoa-era Marvel.

title: The Unstoppable Wasp by Jeremy Whitley Complete Collection
synopsis: Nadia Van Dyne, daughter of Hank Pym, escapes the Red Room and founds G.I.R.L. (Genius In action Research Labs). A joyful series about science, friendship, and mental health awareness.
connection_notes: Spins off from: All-New All-Different Avengers. Parallel: Champions.

title: Legendary Star-Lord
synopsis: Peter Quill stars in his first ongoing solo series. Balancing cosmic adventures with romantic entanglements with Kitty Pryde. Features the Badoon, Thanos's son Thane, and Mr. Knife (J'son of Spartax).
connection_notes: Parallel: Guardians by Bendis. Leads to: Secret Wars (2015).

title: Star-Lord by Chip Zdarsky
synopsis: Peter Quill is stranded on Earth after Secret Wars, working at a bar and trying to be a regular person. A charming, grounded story about an intergalactic adventurer stuck in mundane life.
connection_notes: Follows: Secret Wars (2015). Leads to: Guardians of the Galaxy relaunch.

title: Rocket Raccoon by Skottie Young
synopsis: Rocket's solo adventures in Skottie Young's kinetic, cartoony style. Rocket is framed for murder and must clear his name while discovering another raccoon from Halfworld exists.
connection_notes: Parallel: Guardians by Bendis. Standalone fun.

title: Rocket by Al Ewing
synopsis: Rocket takes a heist job to save an old flame, leading to a noir-tinged space crime story. Ewing brings his signature layered plotting to Rocket's solo adventures with unexpected emotional depth.
connection_notes: Parallel: Guardians ongoing. Leads to: Infinity Countdown.

title: Drax the Destroyer: Earth Fall
synopsis: The miniseries that redesigned Drax from his bulky classic look into the lean, tattooed warrior of Annihilation. Drax crash-lands on Earth and bonds with a young girl while hunting a convict transport.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Directly leads to Annihilation. Sets up modern Drax design.

title: Patsy Walker AKA Hellcat by Kate Leth
synopsis: Patsy Walker starts a temp agency for super-powered people who need regular jobs. A warm, funny series that embraces Patsy's romance-comic history. She-Hulk, Jubilee, and Howard the Duck guest star.
connection_notes: Spins off from: She-Hulk by Soule. Parallel: All-New All-Different Marvel.

title: Elektra by Peter Milligan
synopsis: Elektra takes on assassination contracts while wrestling with her resurrection and moral compass. A dark Marvel Knights series exploring Elektra's psychology beyond her Daredevil connections.
connection_notes: Follows: Elektra by Frank Miller. Parallel: Daredevil by Bendis.

title: Daredevil: Woman Without Fear
synopsis: Elektra takes up the Daredevil mantle while Matt Murdock is in prison. A bridge series between Zdarsky's Daredevil volumes, featuring Elektra fighting the Hand as the new Woman Without Fear.
connection_notes: Follows: Daredevil by Zdarsky Vol. 1. Leads to: Daredevil by Zdarsky Vol. 2.

title: Elektra: Black, White & Blood
synopsis: Anthology series featuring Elektra stories by top creators in a striking black, white, and red art style. Short tales spanning her career as assassin, hero, and everything in between.
connection_notes: Standalone anthology. Companion to: Daredevil: Black, White & Blood.

title: Iron Fist: The Living Weapon by Kaare Andrews
synopsis: Danny Rand confronts the truth about his father's legacy and K'un-Lun's destruction. A visually experimental take with Andrews's painted art. Introduces Pei, Danny's young successor-in-training.
connection_notes: Follows: Immortal Iron Fist. Leads to: Power Man and Iron Fist (2016).

title: Iron Fist: Heart of the Dragon
issues_collected: Iron Fist: Heart of the Dragon #1-6
synopsis: Someone is killing the dragon guardians of the Heavenly Cities. Danny Rand teams with Luke Cage and other Immortal Weapons to stop the threat. Features the return of classic Iron Fist mythology.
connection_notes: Follows: Immortal Iron Fist lore. Parallel: ongoing Marvel continuity.

title: Spider-Woman by Dennis Hopeless & Javier Rodriguez
synopsis: Jessica Drew quits the Avengers, becomes a PI, and has a baby. Rodriguez's innovative layouts make this a visual masterpiece. Features Ben Urich, Porcupine as a love interest, and Jessica as a new mom superhero.
connection_notes: Follows: Spider-Verse. Parallel: All-New All-Different Marvel. Leads to: Spider-Woman by Pacheco.

title: Spider-Woman by Karla Pacheco
synopsis: Jessica Drew is dying from a mysterious illness and must find a cure while battling new and old enemies. A high-energy run that redesigns her costume and deepens her relationship with Captain Marvel.
connection_notes: Follows: Spider-Woman by Hopeless. Parallel: Krakoa-era Marvel.

title: Mockingbird by Chelsea Cain
synopsis: Bobbi Morse investigates a conspiracy aboard a S.H.I.E.L.D. cruise ship while flashbacks reveal her Ph.D. research and spy origins. A witty, structurally inventive take on Marvel's premier spy.
connection_notes: Standalone. Parallel: All-New All-Different Marvel.

title: Wonder Man Classic Complete Collection
synopsis: Simon Williams tries to make it as a Hollywood actor while being an Avenger. Features his ionic powers evolving, his complicated relationship with Vision, and the Grim Reaper's vendetta.
connection_notes: Parallel: Avengers. Ties into: Operation Galactic Storm, Infinity War.

title: Monica Rambeau: Photon by Eve Ewing
synopsis: Monica Rambeau returns to New Orleans to deal with a family crisis while confronting a threat from another dimension. Explores Monica's identity beyond her many codenames (Captain Marvel, Photon, Spectrum).
connection_notes: Standalone. Follows: Ultimates by Ewing, Avengers appearances.

title: Captain Marvel: Monica Rambeau Complete Collection
issues_collected: Amazing Spider-Man Annual #16, Avengers #227-239 (Monica stories), Captain Marvel (1989) #1
synopsis: Monica Rambeau gains light-based powers, becomes Captain Marvel, and joins the Avengers — eventually leading the team. The original Captain Marvel Monica run, collecting her key Avengers appearances.
connection_notes: Leads to: Avengers (Monica as chairwoman). Parallel: Roger Stern's Avengers run.

title: Ben Reilly: Scarlet Spider by Peter David
synopsis: Ben Reilly, resurrected by the Jackal as a morally compromised figure, sets up in Las Vegas trying to be a hero again. Features Kaine, Cassandra Mercury, and Ben's struggle between villainy and heroism.
connection_notes: Follows: Clone Conspiracy. Parallel: Amazing Spider-Man ongoing.

title: Silk Vol. 2 by Pak & Kim
synopsis: Cindy Moon balances her job at the Fact Channel with superheroics and searching for her missing family. Features her undercover infiltration of Black Cat's criminal empire and her ties to Spider-Man.
connection_notes: Follows: Spider-Verse (Silk's debut). Parallel: Amazing Spider-Man ongoing.

title: Valkyrie: Jane Foster by Aaron & Ewing
synopsis: After War of the Realms, Jane Foster becomes the new Valkyrie, guiding the dead to the afterlife. Balances being a doctor for the living and a shepherd of the dead. Features Heimdall's death aftermath.
connection_notes: Follows: War of the Realms, Jane Foster's Thor run. Leads to: King in Black tie-ins.

title: Tigra: The Complete Collection
issues_collected: Giant-Size Creatures #1, Monsters Unleashed #10, The Cat #1-4, Marvel Chillers #3-7, Marvel Premiere #42
synopsis: Greer Grant transforms from The Cat into Tigra via Cat People magic. Collects her origin across multiple series. A Bronze Age curiosity that established one of Marvel's most recognizable Avengers B-listers.
connection_notes: Leads to: Avengers appearances, West Coast Avengers membership.

title: Gambit Classic Omnibus
synopsis: Remy LeBeau's solo adventures as the Ragin' Cajun. Features the New Son saga, Gambit's guilt over the Morlock Massacre, and his relationship with Rogue. The Thieves' Guild and Assassins' Guild at war.
connection_notes: Parallel: Uncanny X-Men. Spins off from: X-Men ongoing.

title: Gambit by James Asmus
synopsis: Gambit returns to his thieving roots, stealing supernatural artifacts across the globe. A globe-trotting heist series that leans into Remy's charming rogue persona over his X-Men connections.
connection_notes: Parallel: Wolverine and the X-Men era. Standalone Gambit story.

title: Bishop: War College
synopsis: Bishop runs Krakoa's War College, training the next generation of mutant soldiers. Features Armor, Surge, Cam Long, and other young mutants navigating Krakoa's political landscape.
connection_notes: Parallel: Krakoa-era X-Men. Part of the Fall of X setup.

title: Forge (2024)
synopsis: Post-Fall of X, Forge builds increasingly impossible inventions to save mutantkind. A solo spotlight on Marvel's greatest mutant inventor as he confronts what he can and cannot fix with technology.
connection_notes: Follows: Fall of X. Parallel: X-Men: From the Ashes era.

title: X-Force: Boom-Boom & Tabitha
synopsis: Tabitha Smith (Boom-Boom) leads a team of C-list heroes against the Beyond Corporation's bizarre weapons. A satirical, explosive romp that became a cult classic. Features Machine Man, Monica Rambeau, Elsa Bloodstone, and The Captain.
connection_notes: Standalone cult classic. Characters appear across later Marvel titles.

title: X-Force: Warpath — Proudstar Legacy
synopsis: Cyclops's black-ops X-Force team featuring Warpath, Wolverine, X-23, and Wolfsbane. James Proudstar takes a central role as the team hunts the Purifiers and confronts Bastion. Dark, violent, essential X-Force.
connection_notes: Follows: Messiah Complex. Leads to: Messiah War, X-Force Vol. 2.

title: New Mutants: Cannonball & Sunspot — Complete Duo
synopsis: Roberto Da Costa (Sunspot) leads A.I.M. as a force for good, with Cannonball as his right hand. Sam Guthrie returns from space with his Shi'ar wife. Features Squirrel Girl, Red Hulk, and Enigma.
connection_notes: Follows: New Avengers by Ewing. Parallel: Secret Empire event.

title: Moon Knight by Charlie Huston
synopsis: Marc Spector hits rock bottom — broken legs, drug addiction, abandoned by Khonshu. Then he claws his way back as Moon Knight, more violent and unhinged than ever. Finch's dark art defines the modern Moon Knight aesthetic.
connection_notes: Follows: Moon Knight classic era. Leads to: Moon Knight by Bendis, then Lemire.

title: Nova by Abnett & Lanning Complete Collection
synopsis: Richard Rider, sole survivor of the Nova Corps after Annihilation, carries the entire Worldmind. Rebuilds the Corps while facing the Phalanx, Skrulls, and the War of Kings. THE best Nova run ever.
connection_notes: Follows: Annihilation. Parallel: Guardians of the Galaxy by DnA. Leads to: Thanos Imperative.

title: Ms. Marvel: The New Mutant by Iman Vellani
issues_collected: Ms. Marvel: The New Mutant #1-4, Ms. Marvel: Mutant Menace #1-4
synopsis: Kamala Khan discovers she's a mutant and navigates Krakoan politics while staying true to Jersey City. Co-written by MCU actress Iman Vellani, who brings deep comics knowledge to Kamala's Inhuman-to-mutant transition.
connection_notes: Follows: Fall of X. Parallel: X-Men: From the Ashes.

title: Venom by Rick Remender Complete Collection Vol. 1
synopsis: Flash Thompson bonds with the Venom symbiote as a government agent. A military thriller that redefines Venom as a hero. Features the Crime-Master, Jack O'Lantern, and Flash's struggle with the symbiote's corruption.
connection_notes: Follows: Spider-Man: Big Time. Leads to: Venom: Space Knight, Venom by Cates.

title: Taskmaster Complete Collection
synopsis: Three Taskmaster miniseries collected. Tony Masters, the man who can copy any fighting style, navigates the mercenary world. The 2020 MacKay series reveals his tragic memory-loss origin and his forgotten wife.
connection_notes: Standalone. Taskmaster appears across Avengers, Thunderbolts.

title: Hercules: Assault on New Olympus
issues_collected: Incredible Hercules #138-141, Assault on New Olympus #1, Hercules: Fall of an Avenger #1-2
synopsis: The conclusion of Incredible Hercules. Herc battles Hera and the Olympus Group, leading to a final sacrifice. Plus the aftermath where heroes mourn and Amadeus Cho takes up the mantle.
connection_notes: Follows: Incredible Hercules Complete. Leads to: Herc ongoing, Amadeus Cho as Hulk.

title: Multiple Man by Matthew Rosenberg
synopsis: Jamie Madrox returns from the dead and discovers his dupes have been living separate lives — one even created a dystopian future. A mind-bending comedy about identity and the consequences of multiplication.
connection_notes: Follows: X-Factor by Peter David, Madrox's death in Death of X.

title: Secret Avengers by Ed Brubaker Complete Collection
synopsis: Steve Rogers leads a covert Avengers team including Beast, War Machine, Nova, and Moon Knight on black-ops missions. Features Shadow Council conspiracy and Nick Fury's secret legacy (#1-12).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Siege/Heroic Age. Leads to: Secret Avengers by Remender. Parallel: Avengers by Bendis.

title: Secret Avengers by Rick Remender Complete Collection
synopsis: Hawkeye takes over as team leader. Venom (Flash Thompson) joins. The Descendants arc pits the team against android infiltrators. High-octane espionage with Remender's signature escalation (#22-37).
connection_notes: Continues from: Secret Avengers by Brubaker. Leads to: Secret Avengers by Spencer. Parallel: Uncanny Avengers.

title: Secret Avengers by Nick Spencer Complete Collection
synopsis: SHIELD-run black-ops Avengers team with memory-wiped agents. Mockingbird, Black Widow, and Hawkeye run missions they won't remember. Comedic espionage tone (#1-16).
connection_notes: Continues from: Secret Avengers by Remender. Ties into: Infinity event. Leads to: SHIELD by Hickman.

title: Avengers Academy Complete Collection Vol. 1
synopsis: Teen heroes traumatized by Norman Osborn train under Hank Pym, Tigra, and Quicksilver. Hazmat, Mettle, Reptil, Striker, Veil, and Finesse grapple with whether they'll become heroes or villains (#1-20).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Avengers Initiative, Dark Reign. Leads to: Avengers Academy Vol. 2. Parallel: Avengers Arena.

title: Avengers Academy Complete Collection Vol. 2
synopsis: Academy relocates to the former West Coast Avengers compound. X-23 and White Tiger join. Ties into AvX as students choose sides. Series finale resolves the heroes-or-villains question (#21-39).
connection_notes: Continues from: Avengers Academy Vol. 1. Ties into: AvX. Leads to: Avengers Arena.

title: A-Force Complete Collection
synopsis: All-female Avengers team featuring She-Hulk, Captain Marvel, Medusa, Dazzler, Nico Minoru, and Singularity. Born from Secret Wars Battleworld, the team reforms in the main universe to face Antimatter (#1-10).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Secret Wars (2015). Parallel: All-New All-Different Avengers. Ties into: Civil War II.

title: S.H.I.E.L.D. by Jonathan Hickman Vol. 1
synopsis: SHIELD has existed since ancient Egypt. Leonardo da Vinci, Galileo, Newton, and Nikola Tesla were agents. Leonid discovers this hidden history and the war between da Vinci and Newton for the organization's soul (#1-6).
connection_notes: Part of Hickman's Marvel architecture. Parallel: Hickman's FF. Leads to: SHIELD Vol. 2.

title: S.H.I.E.L.D. by Jonathan Hickman Vol. 2
synopsis: The war between da Vinci and Newton concludes. Michelangelo, Nostradamus, and Howard Stark play pivotal roles. Connects SHIELD's ancient legacy to the modern Marvel Universe (#1-4, Infinity).
connection_notes: Continues from: SHIELD Vol. 1. Enriches: Hickman's Avengers/FF cosmology. Parallel: Secret Warriors.

title: Heroes for Hire Omnibus (Power Man and Iron Fist)
issues_collected: Power Man #48-50, Power Man and Iron Fist #50-125, Annual #1
synopsis: Luke Cage and Danny Rand partner up as Heroes for Hire. Definitive buddy-superhero series blending street-level action with martial arts. Sabretooth as recurring villain. Controversial final issue kills Iron Fist (#50-125).
connection_notes: Continues from: Luke Cage Hero for Hire Omnibus, Immortal Iron Fist. Leads to: Heroes for Hire (2006). Parallel: Daredevil Miller.

title: Heroes for Hire: Civil War/World War Hulk
synopsis: Misty Knight and Colleen Wing recruit a rotating roster including Black Cat, Shang-Chi, and Humbug during Civil War. The team hunts unregistered heroes before pivoting to face World War Hulk fallout (#1-15).
connection_notes: Ties into: Civil War, World War Hulk. Spins off from: Daughters of the Dragon.

title: Heroes for Hire (2011) Complete
synopsis: Misty Knight runs a street-level Heroes for Hire operation dispatching heroes like Iron Fist, Falcon, Elektra, and Paladin. The Puppet Master secretly manipulates operations from behind the scenes (#1-12).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Shadowland. Features: DnA's street-level Marvel work between their cosmic runs.

title: Midnight Sons Omnibus
issues_collected: Ghost Rider (1990) #28-31, Morbius #1-4, Darkhold #1-4, Nightstalkers #1-4, Midnight Sons Unlimited #1, Spirits of Vengeance #1-4
synopsis: Lilith, Mother of Demons awakens. Ghost Rider, Blade, Morbius, Doctor Strange, and the Nightstalkers unite as the Midnight Sons. Marvel's supernatural corner gets its own crossover event, Rise of the Midnight Sons (#28-31, etc.).
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Ghost Rider Danny Ketch Omnibus. Leads to: Midnight Massacre crossover. References: Tomb of Dracula legacy.

title: Midnight Suns (2022)
synopsis: Inspired by the video game. Wolverine, Blade, Magik, Nico Minoru, and Spider-Man team up to fight a demonic threat involving Valtorr's Vaulting. Modern supernatural team-up with Krakoa-era connections (#1-5).
connection_notes: Ties into: Midnight Suns video game (2022). References: Midnight Sons legacy.

title: Avengers World
synopsis: Companion series to Hickman's Avengers. AIM Island, the City of the Dead, and Smasher's Shi'ar heritage explored. Expands Hickman's expanded Avengers roster including Shang-Chi, Cannonball, and Smasher (#1-21).
connection_notes: Parallel: Avengers by Hickman Omnibus Vol. 1-2. Leads to: Time Runs Out. Part of Hickman's Avengers architecture.

title: Savage Avengers Omnibus by Gerry Duggan
synopsis: Conan the Barbarian teams with Wolverine, Punisher, Elektra, Venom, and Doctor Strange against Kulan Gath's blood magic. Ultra-violent team-up blending Marvel heroes with sword-and-sorcery (#0-28).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Conan's Marvel return. Parallel: Krakoa-era X-Men. Features: Conan in the modern Marvel Universe.

title: All-New All-Different Avengers by Mark Waid
issues_collected: FCBD Avengers 2015, All-New All-Different Avengers #1-15, Annual #1
synopsis: Post-Secret Wars Avengers lineup: Iron Man, Captain America (Sam Wilson), Thor (Jane Foster), Vision, Ms. Marvel, Nova (Sam Alexander), and Miles Morales Spider-Man. Legacy meets new generation (#1-15).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Secret Wars (2015). Leads to: Champions by Waid, Avengers by Waid. Parallel: Uncanny Avengers by Duggan.

title: Dark Avengers Complete Collection
synopsis: Norman Osborn's Dark Reign Avengers: Sentry, Ares, Daken (as Wolverine), Bullseye (as Hawkeye), Venom (as Spider-Man), Moonstone (as Ms. Marvel). Villains wearing heroes' mantles while Osborn runs HAMMER (#1-16).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Secret Invasion, Dark Reign. Leads to: Siege. Parallel: New Avengers Omnibus Vol. 2.

title: Avengers: The Initiative Complete Collection Vol. 1
synopsis: Post-Civil War training camp for registered heroes at Camp Hammond. MVP's death cover-up, the Skrull infiltration of the Initiative, and Hardball's fall from grace. Key Secret Invasion tie-in (#1-19).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Civil War. Ties into: Secret Invasion. Leads to: Avengers Initiative Vol. 2.

title: Avengers: The Initiative Complete Collection Vol. 2
synopsis: Dark Reign transforms the Initiative under Norman Osborn. Taskmaster runs Camp HAMMER. The Shadow Initiative rebels. Concludes with the Siege of Asgard (#20-35).
connection_notes: Continues from: Avengers Initiative Vol. 1. Ties into: Dark Reign, Siege. Leads to: Avengers Academy.

title: Strikeforce Complete
synopsis: Blade, Angela, Spider-Woman, Wiccan, Daimon Hellstrom, and Monica Rambeau discover shapeshifting Vridai are replacing people. Dark supernatural team book with an espionage edge (#1-9).
connection_notes: Spins off from: War of the Realms. Parallel: Valkyrie by Aaron/Ewing.

title: Power Pack Classic Omnibus Vol. 2
synopsis: The Power siblings continue their adventures with power swaps, Inferno tie-ins, and growing up while hiding superhero lives from their parents. Falls of X-Men crossovers and Snark War saga (#32-62).
connection_notes: Continues from: Power Pack Classic Omnibus Vol. 1. Ties into: Inferno, X-Men crossovers.

title: Power Pack (2020)
synopsis: The Power siblings reunite as adults when their parents are kidnapped. Charming all-ages miniseries that honors the original while updating the family dynamic for modern readers (#1-5).
connection_notes: Nostalgia callback to: Power Pack Classic. Standalone miniseries.

title: Great Lakes Avengers Complete Collection
issues_collected: GLA #1-4, GLX-Mas Special, Great Lakes Avengers (2016) #1-7, appearances from Deadpool, Thunderbolts
synopsis: Mr. Immortal, Flatman, Big Bertha, Doorman, and Squirrel Girl as Marvel's most lovable losers. The GLA/GLX/GLC/Great Lakes Avengers prove heroism comes in all forms. Comedy gold (#1-4, 2016 #1-7).
connection_notes: Squirrel Girl spins off to: Unbeatable Squirrel Girl. References: Avengers, Thunderbolts.

title: Alpha Flight by Pak & Van Lente Complete
synopsis: Fear Itself tie-in relaunches Alpha Flight. Canada falls under the Unity Party's authoritarian rule. Guardian, Vindicator, Puck, Sasquatch, and Aurora fight to liberate their country (#0.1-8).
connection_notes: Ties into: Fear Itself event. Continues legacy from: Alpha Flight Omnibus.

title: New Warriors Classic Vol. 2 (Nicieza)
synopsis: The Warriors face the Folding Circle, Trans-Sabal political crisis, and Infinity War crossover. Nova and Namorita's relationship deepens. Turbo and Rage join. The team matures under Nicieza's character work (#26-53).
connection_notes: Continues from: New Warriors Classic Omnibus Vol. 1. Ties into: Infinity War. Leads to: New Warriors Vol. 2 (1999).

title: New Warriors (2014) Complete
synopsis: Justice and Speedball reunite with new members Sun Girl, Hummingbird, Water Snake, and Kaine (Scarlet Spider) to face the High Evolutionary's crusade against Inhumans and mutants (#1-12).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Scarlet Spider by Yost. References: Inhumans vs. mutants tension.

title: New Warriors (2019) Outlawed
synopsis: New generation of Warriors including Screentime, Snowflake, Trailblazer, and B-Negative mentor under the originals after teen heroes are outlawed. Light-hearted team book exploring generational heroism (#1-5).
connection_notes: Ties into: Outlawed event. Parallel: Champions (2020).

title: Thunderbolts by Jim Zub
synopsis: Bucky Barnes leads a new Thunderbolts team including Atlas, Fixer, MACH-X, Moonstone, and Kobik (a sentient Cosmic Cube in child form). Pleasant Hill aftermath drives the team dynamic (#1-12).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Avengers Standoff/Pleasant Hill. Ties into: Secret Empire buildup.

title: Thunderbolts (2022) by Jackson Lanzing & Collin Kelly
synopsis: Hawkeye assembles a new Thunderbolts team including America Chavez, Power Man, Persuasion, Gutsen Glory, and Monica Rambeau. Hawkeye's redemption mission: prove villains can change (#1-5).
connection_notes: References: Classic Thunderbolts legacy. Parallel: Hawkeye: Freefall.

title: Uncanny Avengers by Gerry Duggan Omnibus
synopsis: Post-Secret Wars Unity Squad: Deadpool, Rogue, Human Torch, Doctor Voodoo, Synapse, and Cable. Deadpool secretly funds the team. Red Skull with Xavier's brain returns. Ties heavily into Civil War II and Secret Empire (#1-30).
connection_notes: Continues from: Uncanny Avengers by Remender. Ties into: Civil War II, Secret Empire. Leads to: Uncanny Avengers by Zub.

title: Uncanny Avengers by Jim Zub
synopsis: Rogue leads the Unity Squad with Wasp, Doctor Voodoo, Synapse, Human Torch, and Quicksilver. The team faces the fallout of Secret Empire and rebuilds trust between humans and mutants (#1-5).
connection_notes: Continues from: Uncanny Avengers by Duggan. Ties into: Secret Empire aftermath.

title: Illuminati by Joshua Williamson
synopsis: Hood assembles a villain Illuminati including Enchantress, Mad Thinker, Titania, Thunderball, and Black Ant. Villains plotting to control the criminal underworld of the post-Secret Wars Marvel Universe (#1-7).
connection_notes: Villain-focused counterpart to: New Avengers Illuminati. References: Hood's history from Bendis era.

title: Contest of Champions (2015)
synopsis: Grandmaster and the Collector pit teams of champions from across the multiverse against each other in Battlerealm. Introduces Battleworld survivors Guillotine and White Fox. Connects to the Contest of Champions game (#1-10).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Secret Wars (2015). Leads to: Ultimates by Ewing (shared cosmic themes).

title: West Coast Avengers by Kelly Thompson
synopsis: Hawkeye (Kate Bishop) leads a new West Coast team: Clint Barton, America Chavez, Gwenpool, Kid Omega, and Fuse. Filmed as a reality show. Fun, character-driven comedy fighting BRODOK and land sharks (#1-10).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Hawkeye by Kelly Thompson. References: West Coast Avengers Omnibus legacy.

title: Black Panther and the Agents of Wakanda
issues_collected: Black Panther and the Agents of Wakanda #1-7
synopsis: T'Challa assembles a global defense team: Okoye, Wasp, Gorilla-Man, Fat Cobra, Ka-Zar, American Eagle, and Mockingbird. The Agents handle threats beneath the Avengers' notice, including Sentry's dark side (#1-7).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Avengers by Aaron. Parallel: Black Panther by Coates.

title: Fearless Defenders by Cullen Bunn Complete
synopsis: Valkyrie and Misty Knight lead an all-female team including Dani Moonstar, Elsa Bloodstone, and Warrior Woman against Caroline Le Fay. Assembling new Valkyrior (shieldmaidens) to save reality (#1-12).
connection_notes: Ties into: Age of Ultron aftermath. References: Valkyrie, Defenders legacy.

title: Defenders by Al Ewing (2021)
synopsis: Doctor Strange, Masked Raider, Silver Surfer, Harpy (Betty Ross), and Cloud journey through Marvel's cosmic mythology to find the source of all existence. Explores what came before the First Firmament (#1-5).
connection_notes: Continues Ewing's cosmology from: Ultimates, Immortal Hulk. Leads to: Defenders Beyond (2022).

title: Defenders: Beyond by Al Ewing
synopsis: Blue Marvel, America Chavez, Loki, Tigra, and Taaia (Galactus's mother) journey outside the omniverse itself. Discovers the One Above All and the structure of Marvel's cosmology. Landmark Ewing worldbuilding (#1-5).
connection_notes: Continues from: Defenders (2021). Enriches: Ewing's entire cosmological work from Ultimates through Immortal Hulk.

title: Agents of Atlas by Greg Pak (2019)
issues_collected: War of the Realms: New Agents of Atlas #1-4, Agents of Atlas (2019) #1-5
synopsis: Amadeus Cho assembles the New Agents of Atlas: Silk, Wave, Aero, Sword Master, Luna Snow, and Shang-Chi to defend the Pan-Asian portal cities during War of the Realms. Features Asian and Asian-American heroes (#1-5).
connection_notes: Spins off from: War of the Realms. Continues from: Agents of Atlas Complete (original Pak run).

title: Young Avengers by Kieron Gillen Omnibus
issues_collected: Young Avengers (2013) #1-15, Marvel NOW! Point One #1 (YA story)
synopsis: Wiccan, Hulkling, Kate Bishop, Noh-Varr, Kid Loki, America Chavez, and Prodigy face an interdimensional parasite called Mother. Genre-bending, stylistically groundbreaking run with McKelvie's innovative layouts (#1-15).
connection_notes: Continues from: Young Avengers by Heinberg, Children's Crusade. Kid Loki from: Journey into Mystery by Gillen. Leads to: New Avengers by Ewing.

title: Champions (2020) by Eve L. Ewing
synopsis: Kamala's Law outlaws teen vigilantes. Ms. Marvel, Miles Morales, Nova, Viv Vision, Ironheart, and new members go underground to resist unjust legislation. Kamala Khan's political awakening (#1-10).
connection_notes: Continues from: Champions by Waid. Ties into: Outlawed event. Parallel: Power Pack (2020), New Warriors (2020).

title: Marvel Knights 20th Anniversary
synopsis: Daredevil, Punisher, Jessica Jones, Luke Cage, and Bruce Banner awaken in a world where superheroes never existed. Memory-loss mystery celebrating 20 years of the Marvel Knights imprint (#1-6).
connection_notes: Anniversary celebration of: Marvel Knights era (1998-2004). Standalone miniseries.

title: Winter Guard Complete
synopsis: Russia's superhero team -- Red Guardian, Darkstar, Vostok, Crimson Dynamo, Ursa Major, and Perun -- faces internal power struggles and ancient Slavic threats. Reveals dark secrets of the Red Room (#1-4).
connection_notes: Expands: Black Widow mythos, Red Guardian from movie tie-ins. References: Soviet Super-Soldiers history.

title: Avengers A.I. Complete
synopsis: Hank Pym leads a team of artificial beings -- Vision, Victor Mancha, Doombot, and new AI Monica Chang -- to police the Diamond, a virtual dimension born from Age of Ultron's timeline damage (#1-12).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Age of Ultron event. Features: Victor Mancha from Runaways.

title: Ultimates by Al Ewing Complete
synopsis: Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Blue Marvel, America Chavez, and Spectrum tackle cosmic-scale problems: curing Galactus (#1-6), confronting the First Firmament, and redefining Marvel's cosmology. Ewing's masterwork (#1-12, Ultimates 2 #1-100).
connection_notes: Builds on: Mighty Avengers by Ewing. Leads to: Defenders (2021), Immortal Hulk cosmology. Ties into: Civil War II, Secret Empire.

title: Avengers: The Children's Crusade
synopsis: The Young Avengers search for the Scarlet Witch, who has been missing since House of M. Wiccan and Speed confront whether she is truly their mother. Doctor Doom's role in M-Day revealed. Pivotal for mutant continuity (#1-9).
connection_notes: Prerequisite: House of M, Young Avengers by Heinberg. Leads to: AvX, Uncanny Avengers by Remender. Resolves: Scarlet Witch's M-Day legacy.

title: Mighty Avengers by Dan Slott Complete
synopsis: Tony Stark's official pro-Registration Avengers team: Ares, Sentry, Wasp, Wonder Man, Black Widow, Ms. Marvel. Ultron takes over Tony's body (#1-6). Major Secret Invasion tie-in reveals Skrull infiltrators (#7-20).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Civil War. Parallel: New Avengers Omnibus Vol. 2. Ties into: Secret Invasion.

title: Pet Avengers Complete Collection
issues_collected: Lockjaw and the Pet Avengers #1-4, Pet Avengers vs Avengers #1-4, Tails of the Pet Avengers
synopsis: Lockjaw, Throg (frog Thor), Lockheed, Hairball (Niels the cat), Redwing, and Ms. Lion assemble to collect the Infinity Gems before Thanos. All-ages fun with Marvel's animal heroes (#1-4 x2).
connection_notes: References: Infinity Gems mythology. Comedic standalone team book.

title: New Avengers: A.I.M. by Al Ewing
synopsis: Sunspot buys A.I.M. and transforms it into Avengers Idea Mechanics. Wiccan, Hulkling, Squirrel Girl, Hawkeye, Power Man, and White Tiger operate from A.I.M. Island. Ewing's signature wit with cosmic stakes (#1-18).
connection_notes: Continues from: Avengers by Hickman (Sunspot's arc). Leads to: U.S.Avengers. Parallel: Ultimates by Ewing.

title: Squadron Supreme by James Robinson
synopsis: Survivors from destroyed universes -- Hyperion, Nighthawk, Blur, Doctor Spectrum, Power Princess -- unite in post-Secret Wars 616. They take lethal action, including destroying Atlantis. Morally grey team book (#1-15).
connection_notes: Spins off from: Secret Wars (2015) multiverse destruction. References: Squadron Supreme (1985). Parallel: Ultimates by Ewing.

title: Dark Avengers/Thunderbolts by Jeff Parker
synopsis: Thunderbolts relaunched as Dark Avengers. Skaar, Ragnarok (clone Thor), Toxic Doxie, Ai Apaec, and Trickshot pose as heroes while Luke Cage manages them. Reality-bending finale wraps Parker's run (#175-190).
connection_notes: Continues from: Thunderbolts by Jeff Parker. Leads to: Thunderbolts by Soule (Red Hulk team).

title: Secret Avengers by Ales Kot
synopsis: SHIELD covert ops with Hawkeye, Black Widow, Spider-Woman, and MODOK (as a SHIELD agent!). Surreal, self-aware espionage comedy. Vladimir the sentient bomb. The weirdest Avengers book ever published (#1-15).
connection_notes: Continues from: Secret Avengers by Spencer. Standalone in tone but connects to: SHIELD operations.

title: Avengers: No Road Home
synopsis: Nyx, goddess of night, steals the sun. Hercules, Voyager, Hawkeye, Scarlet Witch, Vision, Hulk, Spectrum, and Rocket traverse mythological realms to reclaim three shards of night. Sequel to No Surrender (#1-10).
connection_notes: Continues from: Avengers: No Surrender. Leads to: Avengers by Aaron. Features: Conan's Marvel debut.

title: Avengers: No Surrender
synopsis: Earth stolen for a contest between Grandmaster and Challenger. All Avengers teams unite. Voyager revealed. Hulk returns from the dead. Weekly event concluding the pre-Fresh Start era with a 16-part epic (#675-690).
connection_notes: Ties together: Waid, Ewing, and Zub Avengers threads. Leads to: No Road Home, Avengers by Aaron, Immortal Hulk.

title: Thunderbolts by Daniel Way & Charles Soule
synopsis: Red Hulk assembles a kill squad: Deadpool, Punisher, Elektra, Venom (Flash Thompson), and Agent Venom. Maximum violence against the worst threats. Soule takes over and adds Ghost Rider (#1-32).
connection_notes: Parallel: Thunderbolts by Parker. Leads to: Thunderbolts by Zub. Dark counterpart to Avengers.

title: Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes by Joe Casey
issues_collected: Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes #1-8, Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes II #1-8
synopsis: Behind-the-scenes retelling of the Avengers' early years. Explores Jarvis's recruitment, the team's government relationship, and the personal costs of being Earth's Mightiest Heroes. Fills gaps in early continuity (#1-8 x2).
connection_notes: Enriches: Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1-2 continuity. Standalone prestige miniseries.

title: Union Jack Complete
synopsis: Britain's street-level hero defends London from vampire terrorists and HYDRA in the 2006 series. Joined by Sabra, Contessa, and Arabian Knight. The 1998 series covers his WWII Invaders legacy (#1-4, #1-3).
connection_notes: References: Invaders legacy, Captain Britain. Parallel: MI:13.

title: Secret Warriors by Jonathan Hickman Complete Vol. 2
synopsis: Nick Fury's endgame: the triple-agent war between SHIELD, HYDRA, and Leviathan concludes. Revelation that HYDRA has been inside SHIELD since its founding. Fury's long game pays off in devastating fashion (#17-28).
connection_notes: Continues from: Secret Warriors Omnibus (Vol. 1). Leads to: SHIELD by Hickman. Prerequisite for: Understanding Hickman's Marvel cosmology.

title: Spider-Man Epic Collection: Great Power
synopsis: The origin of Spider-Man and his earliest adventures. Uncle Ben's death (AF #15), debut of Doctor Octopus (#3), Sandman (#4), Lizard (#6), Electro (#9), Mysterio (#13), Green Goblin (#14), and the Sinister Six (Annual #1).
connection_notes: Leads to: Spider-Man Epic Collection: Great Responsibility. Budget alternative to ASM Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: FF and Avengers origins.

title: Spider-Man Epic Collection: Great Responsibility
synopsis: The culmination of Lee and Ditko's legendary run. Kraven the Hunter (#15 flashback, #34), Scorpion (#20), Molten Man (#28), and the Master Planner Saga (#31-33) -- one of the greatest Spider-Man stories ever told.
connection_notes: Leads to: ASM Omnibus Vol. 2 (Romita era). Budget alternative to ASM Omnibus Vol. 1. Prerequisite: Great Power.

title: Avengers Epic Collection: Earth's Mightiest Heroes
synopsis: The founding of the Avengers. Thor, Iron Man, Hulk, Ant-Man, and Wasp unite against Loki (#1). Captain America revived from ice (#4). Kang the Conqueror debuts (#8). Wonder Man introduced (#9). Cap's Kooky Quartet forms (#16).
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: FF and Spider-Man origins. Leads to: Avengers Omnibus Vol. 2.

title: X-Men Epic Collection: Children of the Atom
synopsis: The original X-Men: Cyclops, Marvel Girl, Beast, Iceman, and Angel under Professor Xavier. Magneto debuts (#1), the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants forms, and the Sentinels first appear (#14). The foundation of mutant mythology.
connection_notes: Prerequisite for all X-Men reading. Leads to: UXM Claremont Omnibus Vol. 1 (Giant-Size relaunch). Parallel: other Silver Age origins.

title: Fantastic Four Epic Collection: World's Greatest Comic Magazine
synopsis: Where the Marvel Universe begins. Mole Man (#1), Skrulls (#2), Namor's return (#4), Doctor Doom debut (#5), Impossible Man (#11), and the Watcher's first appearance (#13). Budget alternative to FF Omnibus Vol. 1.
connection_notes: Leads to: FF Epic Collection: The Coming of Galactus. Budget alternative to FF Omnibus Vol. 1. The starting point of Marvel continuity.

title: Fantastic Four Epic Collection: The Coming of Galactus
synopsis: Peak Lee/Kirby FF. The Inhumans fully introduced (#44-47), the Galactus Trilogy (#48-50) -- the most important cosmic event in early Marvel -- and Black Panther's first appearance (#52-53). Silver Surfer and Galactus debut.
connection_notes: Spins off: Silver Surfer, Inhumans, Black Panther. Budget alternative to FF Omnibus Vol. 2. Leads to: FF Omnibus Vol. 3.

title: Hulk Epic Collection: Man or Monster?
synopsis: Bruce Banner's gamma-irradiated origin and early rampages. The original six-issue series (#1-6) plus the Tales to Astonish continuation. Introduction of the Leader, Abomination, and the Hulk's dual-identity struggle.
connection_notes: Leads to: Incredible Hulk Omnibus (continuation). Parallel: other Silver Age origins. Budget entry point for Hulk.

title: Daredevil Epic Collection: The Man Without Fear
synopsis: Matt Murdock's origin as the blind lawyer turned vigilante. Wally Wood's iconic redesign of the red costume (#7). Early rogues include the Owl, Stilt-Man, and the first clash with the Gladiator. Foundation for all Daredevil stories.
connection_notes: Leads to: DD Miller Omnibus (the run that defined the character). Parallel: other Silver Age origins.

title: Doctor Strange Epic Collection: Master of the Mystic Arts
synopsis: The origin and early adventures of the Sorcerer Supreme. Ditko's psychedelic visuals define Marvel's magical dimension. Dormammu, Baron Mordo, the Ancient One, and the Eye of Agamotto all introduced. The Eternity arc (#130-146) is groundbreaking.
connection_notes: Foundation for all Doctor Strange stories. Leads to: Doctor Strange Englehart/Brunner. Parallel: other Lee/Ditko creations.

title: Black Panther Epic Collection: Panther's Rage
synopsis: The first true Black Panther solo saga and one of comics' first long-form graphic narratives. T'Challa returns to Wakanda to face Erik Killmonger's revolution. Deeply political, beautifully rendered, and ahead of its time.
connection_notes: First essential Black Panther story after FF #52-53 debut. Leads to: Black Panther by Kirby, then Priest. Prerequisite for Killmonger as a character.

title: Luke Cage Epic Collection: Retribution
synopsis: Luke Cage: the first Black superhero to headline his own Marvel series. Framed prisoner gains unbreakable skin and super strength, opens a storefront hero business in Harlem. Gritty, street-level Bronze Age Marvel.
connection_notes: Leads to: Power Man and Iron Fist. Parallel: other Bronze Age new heroes (Iron Fist, Shang-Chi). Foundation for Netflix Luke Cage.

title: Ghost Rider Epic Collection: Hell on Wheels
synopsis: Johnny Blaze makes a deal with the devil and becomes the Spirit of Vengeance. The origin of Ghost Rider in Marvel Spotlight #5, plus the first fourteen issues of his solo series. Motorcycle stunts meet supernatural horror.
connection_notes: Leads to: Ghost Rider Johnny Blaze complete. Parallel: other Bronze Age horror titles (Tomb of Dracula, Werewolf by Night). Foundation for all Ghost Rider stories.

title: Punisher Epic Collection: Circle of Blood
synopsis: Frank Castle graduates from guest villain to solo star. The 1986 limited series that launched the Punisher franchise, followed by the start of his first ongoing. Gritty urban vigilante action that defined 1980s Marvel.
connection_notes: Leads to: Punisher War Journal, Punisher MAX. Character first appeared in ASM #129. Parallel: Daredevil Miller era.

title: Silver Surfer Epic Collection: Freedom
synopsis: Norrin Radd, trapped on Earth by Galactus's barrier, struggles with humanity's capacity for both beauty and violence. Mephisto tempts the Surfer (#3). Deeply philosophical, prestige-format storytelling from Lee's most personal project.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Silver Surfer Omnibus Vol. 1. Prerequisite: FF Omnibus Vol. 2 (Galactus Trilogy). Leads to: Silver Surfer return in cosmic 1990s.

title: Captain Marvel Epic Collection: The Coming of Captain Marvel
synopsis: Kree warrior Mar-Vell is sent to spy on Earth and becomes its champion instead. Introduction of the Kree Empire's ground-level perspective, Yon-Rogg, Carol Danvers (pre-powers), and the Negative Zone Rick Jones bond.
connection_notes: Leads to: Captain Marvel by Starlin, Death of Captain Marvel. Foundation for all Captain Marvel/Carol Danvers stories. Parallel: Kree-Skrull War in Avengers.

title: Defenders Epic Collection: The Day of the Defenders
synopsis: Marvel's 'non-team' assembles: Doctor Strange, Hulk, Namor, and Silver Surfer join forces reluctantly. The Avengers-Defenders War crossover, Valkyrie joins, and the team dynamic of heroes who don't want to be a team.
connection_notes: Leads to: Defenders Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: Avengers ongoing. Features characters from multiple solo titles converging.

title: Iron Fist Epic Collection: The Fury of Iron Fist
synopsis: Danny Rand trained in the mystical city of K'un-Lun becomes the Immortal Iron Fist. Early Claremont/Byrne collaboration before their X-Men fame. Martial arts action meets Marvel mysticism. Leads directly into Power Man and Iron Fist.
connection_notes: Leads to: Power Man and Iron Fist, Immortal Iron Fist. Pre-X-Men Claremont/Byrne work. Parallel: other Bronze Age martial arts titles (Shang-Chi).

title: Spider-Woman Epic Collection: A Tangled Web
synopsis: Jessica Drew, originally created to secure Marvel's trademark, becomes a compelling character in her own right. HYDRA origins, pheromone powers, and a noir-ish detective flavor. Foundation for all modern Spider-Woman stories.
connection_notes: Leads to: Spider-Woman Agent of SWORD, Spider-Woman Omnibus (modern). Parallel: other late-Bronze Age titles.

title: Thor Epic Collection: The God of Thunder
synopsis: Dr. Donald Blake discovers a gnarled walking stick that transforms him into the Mighty Thor. Loki debut (#85), Odin and Asgard introduced, the Enchantress and Executioner appear. The mythological foundation of the Marvel Universe.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Thor Lee/Kirby Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Tales of Asgard backup features, Thor ongoing. Parallel: other Silver Age origins.

title: Iron Man Epic Collection: The Golden Avenger
synopsis: Tony Stark, captured and wounded, builds the first Iron Man armor to escape. Cold War origins, early armor evolution, the Mandarin debuts (#50), and Black Widow's first appearance (#52). The foundation of Marvel's tech hero.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Tales of Suspense Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Iron Man Demon in a Bottle. Parallel: other Silver Age origins.

title: Captain America Epic Collection: The Coming of the Falcon
synopsis: Cap gets his own title and gains his greatest partner. The Falcon debuts (#117) as the first African-American superhero in mainstream comics. Red Skull clashes, MODOK appears, and Cap confronts 1960s political upheaval.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Avengers Omnibus Vol. 1 (Cap's revival). Leads to: Cap Englehart Omnibus (Secret Empire). Foundation for Cap/Falcon partnership.

title: Wolverine Epic Collection: Back to Basics
synopsis: Logan's first ongoing solo series. Patch persona in Madripoor, Jessica Drew crossover, Silver Samurai, and the Gehenna Stone affair. Claremont explores Wolverine independent of the X-Men in a noir-flavored Pacific Rim setting.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: Wolverine by Claremont/Miller limited series. Leads to: Wolverine Hama Omnibus Vol. 1. Parallel: UXM Claremont Omnibus Vol. 4-5.

title: X-Force Epic Collection: Under the Gun
synopsis: Cable transforms the New Mutants into X-Force, a proactive paramilitary mutant team. Deadpool cameos, Domino joins, and the early 90s extreme aesthetic is on full display. X-Force #1 sold five million copies. Peak speculation era.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: New Mutants Omnibus Vol. 2. Leads to: X-Cutioner's Song crossover. Parallel: X-Men (1991) Omnibus Vol. 1. Deadpool spins off from here.

title: Werewolf by Night Epic Collection: Full Moon Rise
synopsis: Jack Russell's lycanthropic curse anchors Marvel's Bronze Age horror line. Moon Knight first appears in #32 of the ongoing (later volumes). Atmospheric horror with a sympathetic monster protagonist and classic Ploog artwork.
connection_notes: Parallel: Tomb of Dracula, Ghost Rider, Man-Thing. Part of Marvel's Bronze Age horror expansion. Leads to: Moon Knight's solo career.

title: New Warriors Epic Collection: Forces of Darkness, Forces of Light
synopsis: Young heroes Night Thrasher, Nova, Namorita, Firestar, Speedball, and Marvel Boy form a new generation of Avengers-level heroes. Fresh and energetic, the team that would later be tragically connected to Civil War's inciting incident.
connection_notes: Leads to: Civil War (Stamford incident). Parallel: early 90s team books. Characters previously appeared in various solo titles.

title: Amazing Spider-Man Compendium Vol. 1
synopsis: Massive budget-friendly collection spanning the entire Ditko and early Romita eras. Every classic villain origin, Uncle Ben's death, the Master Planner Saga, the Goblin mystery, Gwen Stacy and MJ's introductions. The definitive Silver Age Spider-Man.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to ASM Omnibus Vols. 1-2. Covers the most essential Spider-Man stories. Leads to: Spider-Man Death of the Stacys.

title: X-Men Milestone Compendium Vol. 1
synopsis: The essential Claremont X-Men run in one massive, affordable volume. New team formation, Phoenix Saga, Dark Phoenix Saga, Days of Future Past, Brood Saga, and the start of the Morlock storylines. Covers UXM Omnibus Vols. 1-3 content.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to UXM Claremont Omnibus Vols. 1-3. The most important X-Men stories ever published. Leads to: X-Men Milestone Compendium Vol. 2.

title: Avengers Compendium Vol. 1
synopsis: The first fifty issues of Earth's Mightiest Heroes. Team formation, Captain America's revival (#4), Kang debut, Cap's Kooky Quartet, Ultron's origin, and the Vision's introduction. Budget-friendly way to experience Silver Age Avengers.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Avengers Omnibus Vols. 1-2. Parallel: FF, Spider-Man Silver Age. Leads to: Kree-Skrull War in Avengers.

title: Venom Modern Era Compendium Vol. 1
issues_collected: Venom (2018) #1-35, plus Web of Venom tie-ins
synopsis: Donny Cates reinvents Venom mythology. Knull, the God of Symbiotes, is revealed as the void before creation. Eddie Brock's bond with the symbiote deepens. Leads directly into Absolute Carnage and King in Black.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Venom by Cates Omnibus. Leads to: Absolute Carnage, King in Black. Prerequisite for modern Venom mythology.

title: Deadpool Modern Era Compendium
synopsis: The definitive modern Deadpool run. Dead Presidents arc, SHIELD agent Wade, marriage to Shiklah, and the tragedy beneath the comedy. Duggan and Posehn find the emotional core of the Merc with a Mouth.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Deadpool Posehn/Duggan Omnibus. Leads to: Deadpool in Uncanny Avengers. Parallel: other All-New Marvel Now titles.

title: Punisher Compendium Vol. 1
synopsis: Garth Ennis's brutal, unflinching MAX series. Frank Castle in a world without superheroes. Born, In the Beginning, The Slavers, Barracuda, and Long Cold Dark. The most acclaimed Punisher run and a defining work of the MAX imprint.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Punisher MAX Omnibus Vols. 1-2. Mature readers. Standalone continuity. The definitive Punisher story.

title: Wolverine Compendium Vol. 1
synopsis: The first chunk of Wolverine's solo ongoing. Claremont's Madripoor Patch era transitions to Larry Hama's definitive character-building run. Sabretooth rivalry deepens, Weapon X backstory hints, and Logan's struggle with his feral nature.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Wolverine Hama Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Wolverine Hama Omnibus Vol. 2. Parallel: UXM Claremont Omnibus Vols. 4-5.

title: Moon Knight Compendium
issues_collected: Moon Knight (1980) #1-38, Moon Knight Special Edition #1-3
synopsis: Marc Spector, Steven Grant, Jake Lockley -- the original Moon Knight run that established the character's dissociative identity disorder and Khonshu mythology. Sienkiewicz's art evolves from Neal Adams homage to avant-garde expressionism.
connection_notes: Budget alternative to Moon Knight Moench Omnibus Vol. 1. Leads to: Marc Spector Moon Knight Omnibus, then Ellis relaunch. Foundation for all Moon Knight.

title: Marvel Horror Compendium
issues_collected: Tomb of Dracula #1-25, Werewolf by Night #1-15, Ghost Rider #1-10, Man-Thing #1-10
synopsis: The essential Bronze Age Marvel horror titles collected together. Tomb of Dracula's literary vampire saga, Werewolf by Night's lycanthropic tragedy, Ghost Rider's supernatural vengeance, and Man-Thing's swamp horror. Blade debuts in Tomb of Dracula #10.
connection_notes: Parallel: mainstream Marvel Bronze Age. Blade debut here leads to modern Blade stories. Foundation for Blood Hunt (2024).

title: Spider-Man: Clone Saga Complete Compendium
issues_collected: Web of Spider-Man #117-129, ASM #394-406, Spider-Man #51-63, Spectacular Spider-Man #217-229
synopsis: The infamous Clone Saga in its entirety. Ben Reilly returns, Peter's clone or original status flips repeatedly, and editorial chaos reigns. Historically significant as the storyline that nearly destroyed Spider-Man. Essential for understanding 90s Marvel's crisis.
connection_notes: Prerequisite: ASM Omnibus Vol. 3 (original clone storyline). Leads to: Heroes Reborn era. Budget alternative to Clone Saga Omnibus Vols. 1-2. CONTINUITY WARNING: highly contested.

title: Wolverine: Origin
synopsis: The long-awaited origin of Wolverine. Young James Howlett in 19th century Alberta, the first emergence of bone claws, and the tragedy that forged the man who would become Logan. Painted art by Andy Kubert in a prestige format.
connection_notes: Fills in backstory for all Wolverine. Leads to: Wolverine by Claremont/Miller, Weapon X program. Standalone but enriches every Wolverine story.
